isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 5000i and 9000i - CUMMINS ISM AND AHD ENGINE SYSTEM - OPERATION

svcsubsecinfo.para: Refer to the Cummins AHD and ISM - ENGINE CONTROLS circuit diagrams in CTS-5298 or S08225.
The ECM is connected to the International electrical system at two points

item.para: International engine harness 50-way ECM connector (1091) connects to ECM port C-1. This connector links several International sensors, switched power, unswitched power ground, switches, diagnostic connector to the ECM and the J1939 data link. The J1939 data link will interface with the transmission and ABS as required.

International 31-way connector (1093) connects to the Cummins sensor harness. This connector links the vehicle speed sensor, low coolant switch, air conditioner power switch and engine fan controls to the ECM.

svcproc.title: ECM Power
svcproc.para: Power is supplied at all times to the ECM directly from the battery. Circuits 14A and 14B run from the positive battery post to 15 amp fuses. Circuits 14C and 14D run from the fuses to connector (675), then to ECM power connector (1094). Circuits 14C and 14D are split into circuits 14CJ, 14CK, 14CH, 14CG, and 14CF to 50-way ECM connector (1091).
The ECM is grounded from the battery on circuit 11G which is split into circuits 11GCF, 11GCB, 11GCK, 11GCJ, and 11GCH for input to 50-way ECM connector (1091).
Turning the key switch to the ignition or start position applies power to circuit 13Z, 5A fuse F6-D and circuit 13D to the 50-way ECM connector (1091).
